column2: The Mahayana branch of Buddhism is a broad denomination, with numerous sects within it.

This character patronises Madhyamaka Buddhism, a school of thought which argues that all phenomena independently exist yet are dependent on each other.
This character patronises Svatantrika Buddhism, the school of thought of Santaraksita who sought to synthesise the teachings of the Madhyamaka and Yogacara schools.
This character patronises Yogacara Buddhism, a school of thought which argues that all phenomena independently exist and are not dependent on each other.
This character has constructed a Buddhist monument in order to display their wealth and dedication to the Dharma.
This is a Buddhist rock pillar inscription, emulating the style of those created by Ashoka the Great and as such is a site of pilgrimage.
This is a stupa, a Buddhist temple which contains a relic linked to a Buddha or a famous Buddhist and as such is an important of site of pilgramage.
